00043 static void _syx_lexer_token_identifier (SyxLexer *self, SyxToken *token, syx_char lastChar);
00044 static void _syx_lexer_token_number (SyxLexer *self, SyxToken *token, syx_char lastChar);
00045 static void _syx_lexer_token_character (SyxLexer *self, SyxToken *token, syx_char lastChar);
00046 static void _syx_lexer_token_symbol (SyxLexer *self, SyxToken *token, syx_char lastChar);
00047 static void _syx_lexer_token_string (SyxLexer *self, SyxToken *token, syx_char lastChar);
00048 static syx_bool _syx_char_is_closing (syx_char c);
00049 static syx_bool _syx_char_is_single_binary (syx_char c);
00050 static syx_bool _syx_char_is_binary_second (syx_char c);
00051 
00064 SyxLexer *
00065 syx_lexer_new (syx_symbol text)
00066 {
00067   SyxLexer *self;
00068   if (!text)
00069     return NULL;
00070 
00071   self = (SyxLexer *) syx_malloc (sizeof (SyxLexer));
00072 
00073   self->text = self->_current_text = text;
00074   self->_pushed_back = 0;
00075   self->last_char = 0;
00076 
00077   return self;
00078 }
00079 
00085 void
00086 syx_lexer_free (SyxLexer *lexer, syx_bool free_text)
00087 {
00088   if (free_text)
00089     syx_free ((syx_pointer) lexer->text);
00090 
00091   syx_free (lexer);
00092 }
00093 
00100 void
00101 syx_token_free (SyxToken token)
00102 {
00103   if (token.type > SYX_TOKEN_STRING_ENTRY)
00104     syx_free (token.value.string);
00105 }
00106 
00107 static void
00108 _syx_lexer_token_identifier (SyxLexer *self, SyxToken *token, syx_char lastChar)
00109 {
00110   syx_uint32 length = 200;
00111   syx_string str = syx_malloc(length+2);
00112   syx_uint32 i = 1;
00113 
00114   *str = lastChar;
00115 
00116   while ((lastChar = syx_lexer_forward (self)) && isalnum (lastChar))
00117     {
00118       str[i] = lastChar;
00119       i++;
00120     }
00121 
00122   if (lastChar == ':')
00123     {
00124       lastChar = syx_lexer_forward (self);
00125       /* This one is an assignment := */
00126       if (lastChar == '=')
00127         {
00128           self->_pushed_back = 0;
00129           self->_current_text -= 2;
00130           token->type = SYX_TOKEN_NAME_CONST;
00131         }
00132       else
00133         {
00134           syx_lexer_push_back (self);
00135           str[i++] = ':';
00136           token->type = SYX_TOKEN_NAME_COLON;
00137         }
00138     }
00139   else
00140     {
00141       syx_lexer_push_back (self);
00142       token->type = SYX_TOKEN_NAME_CONST;
00143     }
00144 
00145   str[i] = '\0';
00146   token->value.string = syx_strdup (str);
00147   syx_free (str);
00148 }
00149 
00150 static void
00151 _syx_lexer_token_number (SyxLexer *self, SyxToken *token, syx_char lastChar)
00152 {
00153   syx_char s[256] = {0};
00154   syx_int32 stop = 0;
00155   syx_nint radix = 10;
00156   syx_bool sign = FALSE;
00157   syx_bool no_float = FALSE;
00158   syx_nint tol;
00159 
00160   do
00161     s[stop++] = lastChar;
00162   while ((lastChar = syx_lexer_forward (self)) && isdigit (lastChar));
00163 
00164   errno = 0;
00165   tol = strtol (s, (char **)NULL, 10);
00166   if (errno == ERANGE || tol < 0 || !SYX_SMALL_INTEGER_CAN_EMBED (tol))
00167     {
00168 #ifdef HAVE_LIBGMP
00169       token->value.large_integer = syx_calloc (1, sizeof (mpz_t));
00170       mpz_init_set_str (*token->value.large_integer, s, 10);
00171       token->type = SYX_TOKEN_LARGE_INT_CONST;
00172 #else
00173       syx_error ("Integer too large\n");
00174 #endif /* HAVE_LIBGMP */
00175     }
00176   else if (errno != 0)
00177     {
00178       syx_perror ("LEXER");
00179     }
00180   else
00181     {
00182       token->value.integer = tol;
00183       token->type = SYX_TOKEN_INT_CONST;
00184     }
00185 
00186   /* a radix? */
00187   if (tolower (lastChar) == 'r')
00188     {
00189       radix = token->value.integer;
00190       stop = 0;
00191       while ((lastChar = syx_lexer_forward (self)) && isxdigit (lastChar))
00192         s[stop++] = lastChar;
00193 
00194       if (stop == 0)
00195         {
00196           syx_lexer_push_back (self);
00197           return;
00198         }
00199 
00200       s[stop] = '\0';
00201 
00202       errno = 0;
00203       tol = strtol (s, (char **)NULL, radix);
00204       if (errno == ERANGE || tol < 0 || !SYX_SMALL_INTEGER_CAN_EMBED (tol))
00205         {
00206 #ifdef HAVE_LIBGMP
00207           token->value.large_integer = syx_calloc (1, sizeof (mpz_t));
00208           mpz_init_set_str (*token->value.large_integer, s, radix);
00209           token->type = SYX_TOKEN_LARGE_INT_CONST;
00210 #else
00211           syx_error ("Integer too large\n");
00212 #endif /* HAVE_LIBGMP */
00213         }
00214       else if (errno != 0)
00215         {
00216           syx_perror ("LEXER");
00217         }
00218       else
00219         {
00220           token->value.integer = tol;
00221           token->type = SYX_TOKEN_INT_CONST;
00222         }
00223     }
00224 
00225   /* a float? */
00226   if (lastChar == '.')
00227     {
00228       if ((lastChar = syx_lexer_forward (self)) && isdigit (lastChar))
00229         {
00230           s[stop++] = '.';
00231           do
00232             s[stop++] = lastChar;
00233           while ((lastChar = syx_lexer_forward (self)) && isdigit (lastChar));
00234 
00235           token->type = SYX_TOKEN_FLOAT_CONST;
00236           token->value.floating = strtod (s, (char **)NULL);
00237         }
00238       else
00239         {
00240           self->_pushed_back = 0;
00241           self->_current_text -= 2;
00242           no_float = TRUE;
00243         }
00244     }
00245 
00246   /* float e? */
00247   if (lastChar == 'e')
00248     {
00249       if ((lastChar = syx_lexer_forward (self)) == '-')
00250         {
00251           sign = TRUE;
00252           lastChar = syx_lexer_forward (self);
00253         }
00254 
00255       if (lastChar && isdigit (lastChar))
00256         {
00257           s[stop++] = 'e';
00258           if (sign) s[stop++] = '-';
00259           do
00260             s[stop++] = lastChar;
00261           while ((lastChar = syx_lexer_forward (self)) && isdigit (lastChar));
00262 
00263           syx_lexer_push_back (self);
00264           token->type = SYX_TOKEN_FLOAT_CONST;
00265           token->value.floating = strtod (s, (char **)NULL);
00266         }
00267       else
00268         {
00269           self->_pushed_back = 0;
00270           self->_current_text--;
00271           if (sign) self->_current_text--;
00272           self->_current_text--;
00273         }
00274     }
00275   else if (!no_float)
00276     syx_lexer_push_back (self);
00277 }
00278 
00279 static void
00280 _syx_lexer_token_character (SyxLexer *self, SyxToken *token, syx_char lastChar)
00281 {
00282   lastChar = syx_lexer_forward (self);
00283   token->type = SYX_TOKEN_CHAR_CONST;
00284   token->value.character = lastChar;
00285 }
00286 
00287 static void
00288 _syx_lexer_token_symbol (SyxLexer *self, SyxToken *token, syx_char lastChar)
00289 {
00290   syx_uint32 length = 200;
00291   syx_string str = syx_malloc(length+2);
00292   syx_uint32 i = 0;
00293 
00294   /* check for symbol enclosed by quotes like a string #'symbol' */
00295   lastChar = syx_lexer_forward (self);
00296   if (lastChar == '\'')
00297     {
00298       _syx_lexer_token_string (self, token, lastChar);
00299       token->type = SYX_TOKEN_SYM_CONST;
00300       return;
00301     }
00302 
00303   /* if it's not an alpha numeric symbol,
00304      be sure to return a symbol of length 2 representing a binary symbol */
00305   if (lastChar == '-' || _syx_char_is_binary_second (lastChar))
00306     {
00307       *(str+i) = lastChar;
00308       i++;
00309 
00310       lastChar = syx_lexer_forward (self);
00311       if (lastChar == '-' || _syx_char_is_binary_second (lastChar))
00312         {
00313           *(str+i) = lastChar;
00314           i++;
00315         }
00316       else
00317         syx_lexer_push_back (self);
00318     }
00319   else
00320     {
00321       while (lastChar && (isalnum (lastChar) || lastChar == ':'))
00322         {
00323           *(str+i) = lastChar;
00324           i++;
00325 
00326           lastChar = syx_lexer_forward (self);
00327         }
00328       syx_lexer_push_back (self);
00329     }
00330   
00331   str[i] = '\0';
00332   token->type = SYX_TOKEN_SYM_CONST;
00333   token->value.string = syx_strdup (str);
00334   syx_free(str);
00335 }
00336 
00337 static void
00338 _syx_lexer_token_string (SyxLexer *self, SyxToken *token, syx_char lastChar)
00339 {
00340   syx_uint32 length = 200;
00341   syx_string str = syx_malloc(length+2);
00342   syx_uint32 i = 0;
00343 
00344   while (TRUE)
00345     {
00346       while ((lastChar = syx_lexer_forward (self)) && lastChar != '\'')
00347         {
00348           if (i == length)
00349             {
00350               length += 200;
00351               str = syx_realloc (str, length+2);
00352             }
00353           *(str+i) = lastChar;
00354           i++;
00355         }
00356       
00357       lastChar = syx_lexer_forward (self);
00358       if (lastChar == '\'')
00359         {
00360           *(str+i) = '\'';
00361           i++;
00362         }
00363       else
00364         {
00365           syx_lexer_push_back (self);
00366           break;
00367         }
00368     }
00369 
00370   str[i] = '\0';
00371   token->type = SYX_TOKEN_STR_CONST;
00372   token->value.string = syx_strdup (str);
00373   syx_free (str);
00374 }
00375 
00376 static syx_bool
00377 _syx_char_is_closing (syx_char c)
00378 {
00379   switch (c)
00380     {
00381     case '.':
00382     case ']':
00383     case ')':
00384     case '}':
00385     case ';':
00386     case '"':
00387     case '\'':
00388       return TRUE;
00389     }
00390   return FALSE;
00391 }
00392 
00393 static syx_bool
00394 _syx_char_is_single_binary (syx_char c)
00395 {
00396   switch (c)
00397     {
00398     case '{':
00399     case '[':
00400     case '(':
00401     case ')':
00402     case ']':
00403     case '}':
00404     case '!':
00405     case '^':
00406       return TRUE;
00407     }
00408   return FALSE;
00409 }
00410 
00411 static syx_bool
00412 _syx_char_is_binary_second (syx_char c)
00413 {
00414   return !(isalnum (c) || isspace (c) || _syx_char_is_closing (c) || _syx_char_is_single_binary (c));
00415 }
00416 
00418 syx_char
00419 syx_lexer_forward (SyxLexer *lexer)
00420 {
00421   syx_char cc;
00422 
00423   if (lexer->_pushed_back)
00424     {
00425       cc = lexer->_pushed_back;
00426       lexer->_pushed_back = 0;
00427     }
00428   else if (*(lexer->_current_text))
00429     cc = *(lexer->_current_text++);
00430   else
00431     cc = '\0';
00432 
00433   lexer->last_char = cc;
00434   return cc;
00435 }
00436 
00438 SyxToken
00439 syx_lexer_next_token (SyxLexer *lexer)
00440 {
00441   syx_char lastChar, secondChar;
00442   syx_string str;
00443   SyxToken token = {0};
00444 
00445   do
00446     {
00447       lastChar = syx_lexer_forward (lexer);
00448       if (lastChar == '"')
00449         {
00450           lastChar = syx_lexer_forward (lexer);
00451           while (lastChar && lastChar != '"')
00452             lastChar = syx_lexer_forward (lexer);
00453         }
00454     }
00455   while (lastChar && (isspace (lastChar) || lastChar == '"'));
00456 
00457   if (!lastChar)
00458     token.type = SYX_TOKEN_END;
00459   else if (isalpha (lastChar))
00460     _syx_lexer_token_identifier (lexer, &token, lastChar);
00461   else if (isdigit (lastChar))
00462     _syx_lexer_token_number (lexer, &token, lastChar);
00463   else if (lastChar == '$')
00464     _syx_lexer_token_character (lexer, &token, lastChar);
00465   else if (lastChar == '#')
00466     {
00467       if (syx_lexer_forward (lexer) == '(')
00468         token.type = SYX_TOKEN_ARRAY_BEGIN;
00469       else
00470         {
00471           syx_lexer_push_back (lexer);
00472           _syx_lexer_token_symbol (lexer, &token, lastChar);
00473         }
00474     }
00475   else if (lastChar == '\'')
00476     _syx_lexer_token_string (lexer, &token, lastChar);
00477   else if (_syx_char_is_closing (lastChar))
00478     {
00479       token.value.character = lastChar;
00480       token.type = SYX_TOKEN_CLOSING;
00481     }
00482   else if (_syx_char_is_single_binary (lastChar))
00483     {
00484       str = (syx_string) syx_calloc (2, sizeof (syx_char));
00485       *str = lastChar;
00486       token.type = SYX_TOKEN_BINARY;
00487       token.value.string = str;
00488     }
00489   else
00490     {
00491       str = (syx_string) syx_calloc (3, sizeof (syx_char));
00492       *str = lastChar;
00493       
00494       if (_syx_char_is_binary_second ((secondChar = syx_lexer_forward (lexer))))
00495         *(str+1) = secondChar;
00496       else
00497         syx_lexer_push_back (lexer);
00498 
00499       token.type = SYX_TOKEN_BINARY;
00500       token.value.string = str;
00501     }
00502 
00503   lexer->last_token = token;
00504   return token;
00505 }
00506 
00512 syx_string
00513 syx_lexer_next_chunk (SyxLexer *lexer)
00514 {
00515   SyxToken token;
00516   syx_symbol start_text;
00517   syx_string chunk;
00518   syx_uint32 length;
00519 
00520   start_text = lexer->_current_text;
00521   token = syx_lexer_next_token (lexer);
00522 
00523   if ((token.type == SYX_TOKEN_BINARY && !strcmp (token.value.string, "!")) || token.type == SYX_TOKEN_END)
00524     {
00525       syx_token_free (token);
00526       return NULL;
00527     }
00528 
00529   while (! (token.type == SYX_TOKEN_END || (token.type == SYX_TOKEN_BINARY
00530                                             && !strcmp (token.value.string, "!"))))
00531     {
00532       syx_token_free (token);
00533       token = syx_lexer_next_token (lexer);
00534     }
00535 
00536   syx_token_free (token);
00537 
00538   length = lexer->_current_text - start_text;
00539   if (token.type != SYX_TOKEN_END)
00540     length--;
00541 
00542   chunk = syx_strndup (start_text, length);
00543   return chunk;
00544 }
00545 
00547 SyxToken
00548 syx_lexer_get_last_token (SyxLexer *lexer)
00549 {
00550   return lexer->last_token;
00551 }

00554 syx_char
00555 syx_lexer_get_last_char (SyxLexer *lexer)
00556 {
00557   return lexer->last_char;
00558 }
